components.description:
A bag full of money. Depicted as a sack, usually tan, tied off and displaying a dollar sign. May be filled with coins, as most platforms show a rounded bag.

Commonly used for various content concerning wealth and money.
components.title: Money Bag

description:
A bag full of money. Depicted as a sack, usually tan, tied off and displaying a dollar sign. May be filled with coins, as most platforms show a rounded bag.

Commonly used for various content concerning wealth and money.
title: Money Bag

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Money symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A bag that is full of money. Most likely coins, given the shape of the bag. Has a dollar $ sign on it, so as to not confuse it with other ba http://emojipedia.org/money-bag/
emoji_net_data.name: money bag

bn:00028114n: The basic monetary unit in many countries; equal to 100 cents
Official designation for currency in some parts of the world, including Canada, Australia, the United States, Hong Kong, and elsewhere. Its symbol is $.

Dollar is the name of several currencies, including those of Australia, Belize, Brunei, Canada, Hong Kong, Namibia, New Zealand, Singapore, Suriname, Taiwan, the United States, and previously Zimbabwe.

bn:00055653n: A drawstring bag for holding money
A money bag is a bag of money used to hold and transport coins and banknotes from/to a mint, bank, ATM, vending machine, business, or other institution.
A bag, normally with a drawstring, used for holding money.

bn:00068918n: A contract of sale is a legal contract an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller to buyer for an agreed upon value in money paid or the promise to pay same.
An agreement (or contract) in which property is transferred from the seller (vendor) to the buyer (vendee) for a fixed price in money (paid or agreed to be paid by the buyer)
An exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.

A contract that involves an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller (or vendor) to buyer (or purchaser) for an agreed upon value in money (or money equivalent) paid or the promise to pay same.

A source document that documents an agreement between two or more parties based on an understanding that a selling party will commit to selling a specific quantity or value of product over a period of time in exchange for favorable prices and discounts.
Exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.
A contract with the target of the change in ownership (of goods, services, companies, etc)

bn:00020497n: A piece of currency, usually metallic and in the shape of a disc, but sometimes polygonal, or with a hole in the middle.
A flat metal piece (usually a disc) used as money
Piece of hard material produced in large quantities to facilitate trade
Coins are pieces of hard material used primarily as a medium of exchange or legal tender.

bn:00055644n: Means of exchange and measure of value.
A medium for exchanging ownership of the economic values represented by one or more currency units.
A generally accepted means of exchange and measure of value.
An unspecified amount in a currency.
Money is any item or verifiable record that is generally accepted as payment for goods and services and repayment of debts in a particular country or socio-economic context.

Money is commonly defined by the functions attached to any good or token that functions in trade as a medium of exchange, store of value, and unit of account, although economics offers various definitions.
Object or record accepted as payment
The most common medium of exchange; functions as legal tender

bn:00061119n: Transfer of an item of value from one party (such as a person or company) to another in exchange for the provision of goods, services or both, or to fulfill a legal obligation
A sum of money paid or a claim discharged
A transaction to record money that is paid to a supplier or customer for goods or services received. A payment transaction decreases the balance for a customer or vendor.
A past, present, or future settlement of an obligation.
A sum of money paid in exchange for goods or services.
A payment is the transfer of an item of value from one party to another in exchange for the provision of goods, services or both, or to fulfill a legal obligation.

bn:00007922n: A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic, etc.
A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic, leather, etc., to put something in or to carry away.
A flexible container with a single opening
A bag is a common tool in the form of a non-rigid container.
Simple tool in the form of a non-rigid container
